snippet: Mixing only 1 part water with 99 parts sand gives a more stable mix, say physicists who see applications for their finding across several fields.
abstract: Dr Daniel Bonn study in journal Scientific Reports shows that mixing one part water to 99 parts sand gives an optimum mix for building taller sand castles, a finding that could be of interests to engineers, architects and others working with granular substances.
lead_paragraph: Mixing only 1 part water with 99 parts sand gives a more stable mix, say physicists who see applications for their finding across several fields.

headline.print_headline: For Taller Sand Castles, the Secret Is Less Water
headline.seo: For Taller Sand Castles, the Secret Is Less Water
headline.main: For Taller Sand Castles, the Secret Is Less Water
